Journal.Title: Water science and technology : a journal of the International Association on Water Pollution Research

Article.ArticleTitle: Mesoporous TiO<sub>2</sub>/carbon catalytic ozonation for degradation of p-chloronitrobenzene.

AbstractText: In this study, a mesoporous TiO<sub>2</sub>/carbon catalyst (TiO<sub>2</sub>/C) was prepared by a facile impregnation-carbonization approach to catalyze ozonation of p-chloronitrobenzene (p-CNB). The catalyst was well characterized and the catalytic efficiency under various conditions was systematically evaluated. TiO<sub>2</sub>/C has a disordered mesostructure with a high specific surface area. 92.8% of p-CNB (2 μmol/L) can be degraded within 20 min in the TiO<sub>2</sub>/C/O<sub>3</sub> system in the presence of 1 mg/L O<sub>3</sub>, 100 mg/L catalyst, at pH = 5. Based on the evaluation of the effect of basic parameters, it could be deduced that the removal of p-CNB relied on the synthetic effect of catalysis by TiO<sub>2</sub>/C and the autocatalytic induction of p-CNB. The removal efficiency of p-CNB, the structure change and the leaching of Ti ions were also evaluated in five cycles, indicating TiO<sub>2</sub>/C is stable and recyclable for catalytic ozonation in water treatment.
